channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Rain damage to cycle path, 21st September
item.description:
The recent heavy rain has damaged the new cycle path running through pittville park. It looks like some of the reddish surface has been washed away exposing the gravel beneath. The rain has also washed away enough material creating a narrow but deep ditch in the path. This would be dangerous to pedestrians and cyclists - see photos for more details

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 81, Marle Hill Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole / Sinkhole, 21st September
item.description:
Junction with Lawn Cres. Road crumbling at this location close to manhole. About 2m sq area. Become very bad after recent heavy rain. Possible sinkhole or underlying problem.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Lawn Crescent, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: All drainage gulleys in Mill Lane are blocked, 21st September
item.description:
Mill Lane, Winchcombe. Three gulleys are completely blocked and have had no attention for years, the situation getting steadily worse. As a result with heavy rain (such as that on the afternoon of 20th September 2024) surface water gets swept down the steep Mill Lane and then overflows into residents' drives. Our garage at Millfield has been flooded. The gulleys are: !) Coming down Mill Lane from Abbey Terrace, past the Chandos Almouses and at the back of Mill House near the telegraph pole. Gulley completely overwhelmed with silt. There is a big catchment relying on theis gulley 2) On the north side of the jumction of the branch of Mill Lane coming down from Gloucester Street and the section going btowards Abbey terrace, near the back of Mill House. This large gulley is also overwhelmed with silt. 3) In the middle of Mill Lane near the entrance to Mill House We rtesidends have tried to keep the worst of the debris from the gulleys but I think it needs a propoer vacuum suction cleaner to deal with it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mill Lane, Winchcombe, Winchcombe, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gullies outside 4Kings Road and 24 Kings Road are blocked. This resulted yesterday in all the water falling on a kings Road north side running down and flooding the garden of 4Kings Road to a depth of at least 10cm and resulting in water incursion into building., 21st September
item.description:
Drains outside 24 and 4 Kings Road not running well.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Kings Road, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Permanently blocked drain on Priory Terrace, 21st September
item.description:
This drain has never to our recollection been cleaned or cleared of debris. Last night (20 September 2024) it very nearly caused catastrophe with residents’ basements. The photo shows the water after it had subsided. In ‘normal’ rain circumstances it blocks up and really needs attention. It is the only drain on the houses side of the terrace,

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Priory Terrace, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Regarding FixMyStreet ref: 6380737., 21st September
item.description:
